column1: length, just moves across him from leg towards off, and he comes forward to defend
length, moves across from leg to off, and he defends towards short mid-wicket
fuller, towards the pads, and he whips this through the mid-wicket region. Top timing
fuller, outside off, and he leaves
fuller, straighter, and he looks to whip this through the on-side. Splices it off the inside of the bat and it runs to the left of the man at long leg. Enough time to scurry back for the second
length, straighter, and he flicks towards long leg. The man running in, Naseem, misfields and allows extra runs
length, a bit of bounce as it pitches outside off, and Karunaratne has to go on to the back foot to defend this
length, just outside off, and Karunaratne is hurried into a defensive stroke from the crease
fuller, but down the pads, and he can get enough bat to run it down to the unprotected fine leg region
length, outside off, no hint of movement other than with the angle of the delivery, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he leaves it well alone
length, angles in, and he defends towards short cover. Sees the opportunity for a quick single, and takes it easily in the end!
length, and he comes forward to defend a ball angling back in
fuller, and he presses forward to drive. Off the inner part of the bat, but along the ground, to short leg
length, zips back in after pitching, and he comes forward to defend, bat close to body
fuller, wider, and he leaves
length, outside off, moves back in after pitching, but starts wide enough to allow Karunaratne to leave
length, angles in, and he plays it towards the man at backward square leg
fuller, just outside off, and Karunaratne presses forward to defend this right under his head
fuller, a bit wider, and he looks to drive and is beaten outside off. Good movement as it curves away from him
length, straighter, and he plays this towards short mid-wicket. Wanted a run to begin with, but that went far too quickly towards the fielder
length, just outside off, and he defends towards point
length, but starts from well outside off, moving away. Karunaratne lets it pass
length, outside off, and he leaves
oops, he completely gets his radar wrong! It's full, but way down the leg side. Too much for Rizwan to do. Probably a good ball for Karunaratne, had he been on strike
length, straighter, and he defends this towards short mid-wicket
length, towards middle and leg, and he plays it towards square leg. Wants one, but is turned down by the captain at the non-striker's end
fuller, again down the legside, but this time the keeper is able to collect, diving away to his left
length, just outside off, seaming back in, and he presses forward to defend

ooh, this could be close! Fuller ball, but outside off, and Fernando lets it go on and strike the pads. I think he excepts this to seam away or go on straight. Pakistan appeal, but choose not to review. Probably didn't do enough to come back and threaten the stumps
presses forward to defend a length ball just outside off
ooh, good ball! Length, outside off, and Karunaratne has a poke at it. Some good bounce on this, as it moves away off the seam. Beats him
fuller, straighter, and he gets this between mid-on and mid-wicket. Top bit of timing and placement from Karunaratne!
length, just outside off, and he is beaten by this. Plays for movement in, but it goes on with the angle
length, outside off, and he defends towards point
shorter, just outside off, and he defends this towards cover
length, just around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, around off and middle, and he presses forward to defend
length, more towards middle and leg, and he gets behind the line of this to drive this towards short mid-wicket
fuller, towards middle and leg, and he drives this towards the man at short mid-wicket
length, zips across Fernando, who presses forward to defend
length, angles across him, and he leaves. Collected by Rizwan in front of first slip
dug in short, angles into him, and he ducks under this to evade it
length, outside off, seams away, and he leaves
length, angles in to him, and he looks to defend coming forward. Almost overbalances a bit, but does well to punch it towards mid-on
length, outside off, and left alone. A bit of bounce as it seams away
fuller, and he drives this back down the pitch. Looks for some swing, but doesn't get any
length, and he punches this from the crease, just beyond point. An easy single on offer

ooh, this is close! Fuller, and starts from around off and keeps going onwards. Beats Karunaratne as he overbalances in trying to flick. A loud appeal for a leg-before, but they choose not to contest it. Well done, as it would have swung down leg
full ball again, and swings in, and beats him for pace yet again. Hits him pretty high too
full again, and this time down the pads and Karunaratne gets enough bat to run this away towards long leg. Third time lucky for the Sri Lankan captain

looks to go full towards the leg stump again, and he glances this down towards deep backward square leg. Naseem has to run across to his left to field, and is also a bit tardy to get to it and release the ball. They go through for two!
length, angles in again, and he drives this towards short mid-wicket
length, angles in from outside off, and Karunaratne defends compactly from the crease
length, jags across Fernando and pings him on the pad as he plays back. Quite high, though
length, and he defends coming forward
length, a bit of movement back in. Fernando presses forward to defend. Gets some bat on to the pad as it runs towards point. Wants a single, but is turned back
fuller ball, just outside off, and Fernando looks to jag his bat down on it. Just around the outside edge and goes through to Rizwan. Hands on head around for the Pakistan camp. That was close, too!
length, slants away, and he leaves. Not way off the off stump, but well judged by the batsman
fuller, hits on the pads as he looks to whip this away, but this pitches outside leg. Fernando wants a leg-bye, but it doesn't trickle too far from short leg
length, a bit of swing back in, and Karunaratne comes forward to defend
length, swing back in, and he defends towards short mid-wicket
length, outside off, and he defends this
length, comes back a long way from outside off, but he reads this perfectly off the hand. Left alone, and watches it come back in and go through to Rizwan
length, wider, and he presses forward and squeezes this to the left of point. Easy two for him. Well controlled and placed nicely

ooh, pings him on the pads again! Yet again, perhaps going down leg side, though. Fuller ball, and Karunaratne falls over a touch as he looks to flick this. The pace and inward movement beat him, but strikes him with off and middle stumps visible. Squirts away towards square leg
length, straightens into him from outside off, and he defends towards mid-wicket
length, jags back in, and comes off the inside edge, hits his thigh and drops at the crease! Lucky again, the batsman
fuller, and he brings his bat down to drive this towards mid-wicket. Bowled at 142.8kph, and Abbas dives low to his right and picks it up with one hand to save runs for his team
fuller, outside off, and he drives again. Fielded by the captain at cover, diving away to his right
shorter, and he drops it with soft hands towards short mid-wicket, and sets off for a single. Easily through
length, and he presses forward to defend this. No great movement on it, so he just has to cover the line and defend

this has struck him again on the pads. Loud appeal, but they choose not to review this! Angles in from outside off, and hits him quite high, even though it may have just edged leg stump this time. Was given not out anyway, so it might have stayed with the umpire's call
length, zips in, and he defends from the crease
banged in short, and this pitch just doesn't have that much zip. Karunaratne can adjust nicely and guide it towards deep square leg. Some hard running fetches them two
length, and he presses forward to defend this towards cover
ooh, what happened there? This has swung back in a long way, and struck the top of off, BUT THE BAIL DIDN'T COME OFF! How unlucky is that for Shinwari?
fuller, swings in, and he drives this to mid-on
shortish ball, and he plays this towards short mid-wicket. They set off for a run, and there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end, but he's through. And off the mark!
full, beaten outside off as he looks to drive! The feet didn't move to cover for the angle going across him, and he was way off the pace of that too
length, just outside off, bowled at 144.6kph, and he presses forward to drive this towards mid-off
fuller, and he drives this back towards the bowler. A little deflection off the bowler's fingers and it runs beyond mid-on. A single on offer, and taken
length, and he comes forward to defend this, bat close to body
length, angles back in, and he defends this back down the wicket
thick inside edge trickles behind square leg. Length ball slanted into the corridor. Dimuth pokes away from the body with feet not close to the ball. That nipped back in off the surface
length and slight curve away from off stump, defended down the pitch
length and in at middle stump. Shuffles a long way and watchfully dabs this into the leg side. That got big on him
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
oh nicely timed. Length ball just outside off. Seam pointed towards the slips but the ball goes straight on. He leans in and check-drives on the up. Not close to it, but lovely hands
squeezed wide of mid-off. Overpitched ball just outside off. He's too eager to drive this and loses his shape. Feet planted to the crease. Goes off the thick outside edge
full on middle stump, feet planted in the crease as he looks to drive. Rolls out to mid-on off the inside part of the bat
rolls through to the keeper after one bounce and goes past slip off his pad. Length ball outside off, left alone
length and just outside off. Tapped back down the pitch on the up
short and hurrying him in the corridor. Looks like he wanted to pull that but was forced to defend into the leg side. 139kph
fends awkwardly into the leg side. Another short of a length ball hurrying him in the corridor. He wanted to glance that behind square but awkwardly lobbed it pitch side
length and just outside off, solidly behind the line to defend this
short of a length and angled into the pads. Looks to flick and cops that on the thigh guard

sweetly driven. Floated full and wide outside off. Gets forward, gets low, and reaches out to punch this firmly through the covers. Not too much movement and so it doesn't matter that he had to reach out for this
short of a length just outside off. Tapped down the pitch off the back foot
overpitched outside off, driven off the low part of the bat to extra cover
length on off stump, uses the angle to nudge this to fine leg's right
length and just outside off. Solidly forward to defend into the covers
length and in at middle stump, defended with the angle
yorker length at the stumps, jammed into the leg side
length, angled in and straightening outside off. Watchfully left alone. Doesn't carry to the keeper
overpitched on middle stump, allows that to come in and uses the pace to just clip this in front of midwicket
short of a length outside off, left alone

struck him. Helmet? Neck? My first thought was just under the neck. He went down to the floor with full control, which is a good sign. Smiling now and jumping back up on this feet as the doctor runs on. He was ducking a short one coming in from outside off. That didn't rise too much. Looks like he's indicating that it hit the bone on the base of his neck. Just above where his name is on the jersey. He was taking his eyes off that one
length and just outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length in the corridor, punched on the front foot to mid-off
length and just outside off, mistimed flick to midwicket
length and in at middle stump. Plants the front leg across and flicks to mid-on
misfield at point. Short of a length outside off, punched handsomely on the rise. Goes under the sliding fielder and extra cover has to give chase
length and just outside off, shuffles and defends into the off side
inside edge to fine leg. Short of a length in the corridor and he lazily hangs the bat out at it, no feet movement
mix up but they sneak a run. Length in the corridor, nudged to mid-on's right and a late call
short ball, down leg side. Left alone.142kph that one
beaten. Short and wide outside off, looks to cut that but it's quickly past him. 140.4kph
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
bouncer, dug in too short. Easily ducked as it sails down leg side
short of a length and just outside off. Punched to point off the back foot
short and just outside off. Chopped on the bounce to backward point
shot. These are just throwdowns at the moment. 130kph and lobbed full and just outside off. Gets the front leg across and punches it between non-striker and stumps
length and angled towards leg stump. Shuffles and gets the front leg across before tickling this fine
length and in the corridor, defended off the inside half
length in the corridor and shaping away off the pitch. Defended off the outside half of the bat
overpitched in the corridor. Driving with static feet and with little control. Thick outside edge to the point boundary
length and just outside off. 144.5kph. Defended off the inside half
finally gets the radar right on a bouncer. Banged in and headed towards the helmet. Nicely ducked
length and just outside off. Gets forward and defends off the inside half on the front foot
length and just outside off. Defended to extra cover off the back foot
length and angled into the stumps. Flicked to short leg on the bounce
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length and wide outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, looks to flick without getting forward. Turning bat meets this
short of a length and just outside off. Tapped into the covers off the back foot
length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short and just outside off, cut on the bounce to point

outside edge dribbles past second slip and that will be his fifty. Late movement away for Shaheen. Draws him forward outside off and he looks to defend with soft hands. Not sure that would have carried to third slip, and I'm not sure a lot will in this match. Four at third man
short of a length just outside off, stabs away from the body off the back foot and gets it between gully and point
length and into the corridor, gets forward and pokes to midwicket
length ball just outside off, punched on the rise to extra cover
short of a length just outside off, on the back foot to tap this into the leg side
length ball outside off, left alone
length and just outside off. Shuffles into line and defends on the front foot
length in the corridor, defended into the leg side
short of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side
leans into this one. Drive on the up and through the line. That shot sums up how this surface has been. Length ball wide outside off, plenty of time to get into that and find the cover boundary
length and drifted up at middle stump. Shoveled to backward squared from the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to mid-off's left. Diving stop from 12th man Imam
lobbed up at a length on off stump, pushed into the leg side
full toss on middle, flicked to deep midwicket

that is gorgeous! Wow. Length ball tossed up at off stump. He jumps quickly down at this, gets to the pitch and offers the full face as he check-punches a straight drive for six over the bowler. Total control
short and just outside off, cut firmly to sweeper cover
length, angles across him, and he stretches forward to drive this towards mid-off
fuller, and he stretches to drive this towards cover. Pitched around off
length, angles across him, and he leaves. With a bit of a flourish, too!
straighter, full, and he stretches forward to drive towards short mid-wicket
length, angles across him, as he comes forward to defend this towards point
length, nibbles away after pitching around off, and he leaves
length, angles across Karunaratne, who punches this towards point
length, and he plays it with the inner part of his bat towards square leg
dropped shorter, and he goes back and defends with a dead bat
length, outside off, goes through at 142kph, and he leaves
length, and he comes forward to defend a length ball just around off
short, and he leaves this as it angles down the leg side. Good pace, good bounce, but a touch misdirected. Great take from Rizwan, stretching away to his left
length, and he presses forward to defend a ball jagging back in from outside off
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend this towards mid-on
length, jags back from outisde off, and he hops to punch this towards cover
presses forward to meet a length ball around off. Defended towards cover
fuller, around off, and he drives this back towards the bowler. Afridi looks to collect and have a shy at the stumps, but cannot collect the ball clean on his follow-through
length, and he punches this as it slants into him, but cannot beat mid-on. Well hit, but just not placed well enough for runs
length, a hint of movement back in, and he drives this back towards the bowler
length, and he eases into a cover drive. Just a half-step into it, and it has the legs to make the cover boundary. Lovely!
length, just around off, and he gets behind the line and defends this with a drive towards mid-on
shorter, and he swivels across and plays this towards deep square leg. Good pace, at 141.6kph!
length, angles away from him, and he taps this towards cover with soft hands. Wants a single, but the fielder is quick to attack the ball
length, angles away from him, and he plays a delightful late cut, from the crease. Gets it between gully and point, and is able to pick up an easy single

that should be it, and is given! Given out leg before, to a full ball that seemed headed for the base of middle. Karunaratne has reviewed this. Bowled from fairly close to the stumps, and had the pace to beat the inside edge, as Karunaratne fell over, as he has a tendency to do, when flicking. That is hitting the base of leg stump, and Pakistan have that breakthrough
shorter, angles across him, and he drops his shoulders and lets this pass through
length, and he leaves as this angles across him
fuller, outside off, looking for some swing away, and he drives from the crease. Cannot beat mid-off
length, angles away from him from over the wicket, and he leaves
fuller ball, towards the leg side, and he looks to flick this away. Off the inside edge, on to pad, and down towards square leg
length, just around off, and he defends from the crease, shuffling across to cover the line
outside off, and he leaves
fuller, straighter, and he defends a ball delivered at 143.8kph
around off, and he defends this from the crease
ooh, what a ball! A touch fuller, and this pitches, bounces and moves away and beats the outside edge. Mendis was caught between looking to attack and defend
length, nipping away, and he leaves this
length, outside off, and he presses forward and slices this along the ground past point. Eased into the shot, and may have intended to play this a bit more square, but he won't complain
length, just around off, and he presses forward to defend. Inside edge on to pad, and that's why there's a stifled appeal from the bowler as it trickles back down the wicket
length, straighter, and he shuffles across and maneouvres this wide of short mid-wicket. Easy single
fuller, and he drives this wide of cover, and almost past mid-off. Azhar dives away to his left after making his way towards the ball, and is able to cut off a potential boundary
short, angles across him, and Fernando leaves comfortably. Collected by Rizwan with fingers pointing upwards, around his right shoulder
fuller, around off, and he drives this hard back down the pitch. Just bounces beyond Afridi, but collected by mid-off
length, just outside off, and defended from the crease
presses forward to defend a length ball, that stays down a touch!
length, around off, nipping back in, and he presses forward to defend
dug in short, and he ducks under this. Goes well over leg stump, but strangely doesn't bounce as much. A couple of balls from this end have kept low this over, and we're just in the first day
another good ball! Good length, nips away after pitching, and teases the outside edge and then swings away a touch through to the keeper
fuller ball, and he whips this off middle stump towards short mid-wicket
length, just outside off, and he shoulders arms to one that goes in a touch with the angle. Not close enough to bother the stumps, though
length ball, but sliding down leg as it strikes the batsman, who looks to whip it away towards fine leg<u></u>
shorter, and he plays this cautiously from the crease. Good line, but perhaps a comfortable enough length on this pitch, especially at Abbas' pace
length, and he plays him from the crease, weight on the back foot, towards point
length, jags back in a touch, and he presses forward to defend
length, around off, and he defends from the crease

length, just straightens after pitching around off, and clips the outer edge of the bat, and runs through towards gully along the ground. Well played by Mendis, who met it with soft hands, and with bat close to body
length, just outside off, and he defends from the crease. A bit of a gap between bat and pad, but the lack of movement allowed him to meet the ball comfortably
oh, lucky! Touch fuller from Naseem, and he was looking to go inside out towards cover. This flies off the edge and goes past point through to the backward point fence

got him this time! Naseem has threatened with this ball a few times this session, and finally he strikes. Gets a ball to pitch on a good length, and just a touch of movement takes it away from Fernando, who gets drawn into poking his bat at it. Travels low to the right of Haris Sohail at first slip, and he moves swiftly to complete the catch. The two set batsmen have been dismissed
length, just around off, and he leaves. This one grubs along the ground through to Rizwan
length, a bit of inward movement with the angle of release from outside off, but an unruffled Mathews lets it pass through
length, sharp ball angles into him at 141.5kph, and he plays it along the ground towards short leg
length, around off, and he goes back in the crease to defend this
a touch shorter, and he goes back and punches this towards point
short, and he goes back and punches this between gully and point. Easy pickings, with not much movement, especially if dropped short
length, and he gets behind the line of this, around off, and defends
length, and he plays from the crease, bringing his bat down to defend one pitching around off
length, around off, and he defends comfortably. At 129.4kph, Abbas has by far been the easiest to negotiate among the seamers
length, squares Mathews up, and just kisses the outisde edge as he is trapped in front of the stumps. Almost went through to the slips too! Great bowling again
fuller, around the pads, and he flicks it away towards short mid-wicket
length, way outside off, and he leaves
length, nips back at him, and he defends from the crease
length, nips back in from outside off, and he leaves this after watching it through
straighter, but ends up straying towards the pads, and he can whip it away towards deep square leg
length, just around off, and he presses forward to defend this
fuller ball, down the pads, and he whips it away towards long leg. Protection there prevents more than just one
back of a length, and he hangs back to drop this right at his feet
length, and he presses forward to defend this
length, outside off, and Mathews leaves. A touch of movement, but after passing the batsman
fuller ball, straight towards him, and he defends pressing forward to meet it
straightens after curving in at off stump. Good length ball and he was defending with soft hands. It ended up at gully off the outside half
short of a length outside off, neatly punched to point's right off the back foot
full and in at the stumps. Deep in the crease and defended watchfully
length and just outside off. Defended to gully off the outside part
short of a length and wide outside off, reaches out and punches it through the covers. Masood in chase again, and throwing it on the bounce again
length and wide outside off. Left alone
full and in at off stump. Watchfully defended to mid-off
length and wide outside off, left alone
full at middle stump, jammed to mid-on
short of a length in the corridor. Shapes to pull, gets it off the inside half to square leg. That didn't rise
length at off stump, defended to point off the back foot
length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket from deep in the crease
length and angled in at off, blocked on the front foot
length and shaping away outside off, left alone
beats him. Lovely delivery. Length ball jumps away from him late as he gets forward to try and defend this outside off

squares him up. Another length ball shaping away late. This time he gets deep in the crease, on the back foot to defend this. Probably to protect himself from edging on the front foot. Pitch slow enough to be able to do that
length ball wide outside off, left alone

got him! Top-class bowling! I said two balls ago that Mendis dug deep into the crease to protect himself from edging the outgoing delivery. This time he goes fishing away from his body on the front. Length ball again, marginally fuller, and draws Mendis into the drive. Late movement away and then off the seam as well. Foot nowhere close for the drive and the edge carries nicely through to the keeper
outside edge and through the cordon for four. Length ball squares him up. Mathews very deep in the crease and swishing at this as it shapes away from middle
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
just bounces over the stumps. Mathews has been very tentative. Length ball outside off, a half-hearted jab away from the body and an inside edge into the pitch. He's safe. Indecisive there
length on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket's right. Substitute fielder Yasir Shah leaps to his right to save the run
short of a length on leg stump, cops it on the thigh after walking down at it
length ball, shaping away but too wide to make him play
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and floating away just outside off. Pushes into the covers, away from the body
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
nice looking shot. Full and just outside off. Gets behind this as he drives along the floor to extra cover
length on middle stump, clipped wide of mid-on with the angle
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to point's right

what a ball! Oh this is sensational! Pakistan have figured this pitch out and completely tied Sri Lanka up this session. This is classic Abbas - signs of maybe a comeback from his form slump. Slams it in at a length on a middle and off line, jags it away off the pitch and clips the top of off stump as Chandimal gets back in the crease to defend. It was a scrambled seam. Past the outside edge and cleaned up. Superb, just superb
length ball into the corridor. Shuffles a long way across and defends on the front foot
length at off, shuffles and defends into the leg side
length on middle stump, shuffles and tickles it to fine leg's right
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full and just outside off, defended into the covers
full on middle stump, flicked straight to mid-on
length ball shapes away late outside off. On the back foot to defend into the covers
short ball. The first of this spell. Slanted in at his body. Ducks to let it go
length and just outside off. Pushed into the covers off the back foot
length ball just outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length ball in the corridor, shuffles and defends into the covers
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball down leg side, shuffles and misses on the flick
length on off stump, shuffles to get behind the line, dead-bats it down the pitch
length on middle stump, flicked to square leg
length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
full and just outside off. Looks to drive, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on
short of a length just outside off. Shuffles to get behind the line and drops it into the leg side with soft hands
short of a length just outside off, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
full at middle stump, looks to drive down the ground. Gets it to midwicket off the inside half
bouncer at leg stump, ducks under it
short of a length and just outside off. Backs away and cuts to point
length and just outside off, looks to drive and mistimes it. It trickles back down the pitch
length ball wide outside off, left alone
past mid-on. Full and just outside off, leans in and wants to drive straight. Slight turn of the bat gets it past the non-striker, and Naseem can't get to that after diving
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover
length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, punched to mid-on off the front foot
yorker at leg stump, jammed to mid-on's right
oh nearly foxes him with the slower ball! Yorker length at off stump. Mathews is into the flick but is too early. It lobs up in the leg side but there's no one at midwicket
full, wide, and he stretches to meet it and defends it back towards the bowler
straighter, and he drives this hard back down the wicket
length, outside off, and he leaves
length, just outside off, angles back in, and he presses forward to defend
short, wide, and he goes back and punches this hard, but cannot beat cover. Diving stop by substitute fielder Imam prevents runs
fuller, and he drives this down the wicket
length, angles across and he defends off the back foot
fuller, and he looks to go a bit forward, but stays back with his body weight in trying to check-drive. It goes along the ground towards mid-off
fuller length, angles across him, and he presses forward to drive towards mid-off
back of a length, angles across him, and he stays back to drop it dead at his feet with soft hands
length, and he hangs back to defend this
fuller, and he drives to mid-off
length, and he defends from the crease
fuller, and he drives, but cannot place it past mid-off
length, and he hangs back and looks to drive this towards cover
length, angles across him, and he leaves
fuller, a bit wider, and Mathews chases it to defend
length, angles across, and he leaves
length ball, angles back into him but he plays it well, jumping up to get behind the line and flick it away towards square leg
length, and he defends towards point after opening his stance up a bit
short of a length, angles in, and gives him enough time to drop it towards square leg. Easy single taken
short of a length, sliding down leg as he looks to drop it towards fine leg. Off the pad, and drops towards square leg
fuller ball, and he drives this back towards mid-on. Looks for the yorker, but cannot get the length as perfect as required
length, outside off, and he drives, but cannot get it past cover
length, outside off, nips further away, and he leaves
length, angles in to him, and he plays towards mid-wicket
length, outside off, and he drives towards covers. Oversteps as he strives for extra pace
short of a length, and he hangs back and smacks this past point. Dismissive, but actually well controlled!
slower ball, just outside off, and he plays it with soft hands towards mid-wicket

length, but width on offer, and he obliges. Just extends his hands and plays it away past a sprawling point. Superb timing on that again, as it races away to the backward point fence. Holds his left hand with the bat up for the photographers!
length, slants across him, and he presses forward to defend
short of a length, and he looks to pull. The ball keeps a touch low, and he has to adjust to ensure he can get enough bat to play it towards mid-wicket
length, angles in, and he plays it wide of mid-wicket. Mid-on has to move across to his right, and they go through for one
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, but on the pads, and he can whip this away towards wide long-on. Easy two before the sweeper at deep mid-wicket can get around
dug in short, and he ducks under this. Doesn't rise much, but goes well over his right shoulder
this was wider, and he was lulled into a drive. Uppish, and just beyond the man at cover. That wasn't convincing at all!

straighter, fuller, and he flicks this away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Both fielders chase this, and that side of the outfield is a little grassier, and it pulls up ahead of the boundary
length, nips away, and he plays it off the back foot towards point
length, and he plays this with soft hands well ahead of mid-on. They set off immediately, and complete a run easily
length, around off, and he defends after pressing his body weight forward
short of a length, and he looks to drive from the crease. Off the inside edge, and he chops it down to the fine leg boundary! Didn't know a lot about this, bowled at 141.5kph
short, and this time he has done well to control a pull towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he drops this dead at his feet from the crease after getting behind the line
length, angles in, keeps a touch low, and de Silva goes back to whip this through the mid-wicket region towards the sweeper in the deep
full ball, and he looks to drive this back towards mid-on. Misfield, and this goes beyond the fielder, and then trickles across the long-on boundary. They need to back their bowlers better
short ball, bad length to bowl on a slow pitch, and Mathews cashes in! Rolls his wrists to get this well in front of square, and wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket
length, outside off, and he goes back to defend this from the crease
length, honing in on the stumps, and keeps a touch low, but Mathews adjusts well to defend this from the crease
short of a length, and he presses forward to defend this from the crease
fuller, and he drives this towards point
length, outside off, and he drives this towards mid-off
short of a length, and he goes back and punches this towards mid-wicket
slower ball attempted, but starts way outside off. De Silva has a smile after he sees it through. Attempted side-of-the-hand, sneaky but not as effective as he would have wanted
drives this towards cover
fuller ball, and he drives this towards mid-on. Half stop by the man stationed there, and Abbas cannot prevent the single from being taken
fuller ball, but down the pads, and he has whipped this off his pads towards deep square leg. Enough pace to beat the man at long leg as well
length, and he plays it with the angle across him towards covers, keeping it along the ground
length, angles away, and he plays a delightful stand-and-deliver drive, straight and hard to cover
length, and he presses forward to defend

fuller, on the pads, and he has spanked this back past mid-on towards the long-on fence! The ball is old now, there's not much reverse in the air, and a tiring Pakistan pace attack is beginning to leak runs
length, jags back in, and he whips it along the ground towards short mid-wicket
short, just outside off, and he drops it with his bat. Wants a quick single, but de Silva wasn't quick to respond
length, keeps a touch low, just around off, and Mathews gets behind the line to defend it. Toe-end of the bat, but good enough to keep it out
short of a length, with some width, and he crunches a cut, but cannot beat point. Shan Masood at that position gets to his right quickly
length, and he presses forward to defend this
fuller length, straighter, and he plays it away towards mid-wicket
length, around off and he presses forward to defend

good ball, just outside off, bounces and beats the outside edge! Naseem has this uncanny knack of getting the ball to lift off a good length, and that takes de Silva by surprise. Also a slightly lazy attempt at a drive
another beaut! Straighter, faster, and just nips past his outside edge as he looks to defend from the crease. Might go fuller now?
length, straighter, and this time de Silva gets well behind it to defend
well controlled as he runs this down past the slips cordon to third man for four! Good ball, on a length, and some movement away, but de Silva adjusts well and plays it late to prevent any mishaps
good length, beats him for pace a touch, and runs off the inside of the bat on to pad and towards short fine leg
ooh, de Silva just losing a bit of concentration now! Looks to run a length ball around off towards third man, and plays under the bounce a touch. Forces a gully to come in now
length, around off, and he defends from the crease this time
length, around off, and he shuffles across to cover the line and punches this towards mid-off
straighter, and he whips this away towards long leg
length, nibbles back in off the seam, and he defends it with a dead bat, stretching forward to meet the incoming ball
length, down the pads, and he has whipped this away towards deep square leg. Easy three on offer, with deep mid-wicket needed to come around and clean up
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length and just outside off, solidly defended into the leg side
full and just outside off, punched to mid-off on the rise

taken at second slip! The first real attempt at a hard hit from Mathews, and he's lost his shape and just had a hack at a very wide length ball. Wanted to slap that through the covers, it absolutely flies to Shafiq's left at slip and he takes a very good reflex catch. That ball was travelling
inside edge to the fine leg boundary. Length ball at leg stump, looks to defend that but played the wrong line, looking for the one that goes across him
length and just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off on the back foot
length and in at off stump, defended down the pitch
past the edge. Loose from Dhananjaya. Length ball outside off, looks to drive through the line but that cuts away marginally
short of a length just outside off, tapped to extra cover's left on the back foot
defended to mid-on
driven through extra cover
length and in at off stump, defended back to the bowler
flicked to fine leg
dragged down leg side, glanced to fine leg off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, looks to run that down to third man. Finds gully on the bounce
length and in at off stump, defended to square leg off the inside half
length in the corridor, defended to square leg off the inside half. Walking down at the bowler
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended to point
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
lbw appeal but that is going over. Short of a length and into the body, beats him on the flick and catches him on the thigh
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
length and in at off stump. Defended on the back foot
length and in at off stump, mistimed drive to mid-on
length ball at off stump, defended on the front foot
length, just around off, and he pushes forward to defend
length, straightens into him, and he plays it away towards mid-wicket
length, swings back in from way outside off. Dickwella leaves, and this has decent bounce as it passes the stumps, but dies on its way through to Rizwan
length, and he presses forward a touch to defend
length, just around off, and he looks to drive, but miscues it a touch. Dobbles away towards mid-on
fuller, and wider, and he drives this through covers. Absolutely gorgeous from DDS! Just a short movement of his front foot, and then hits it crisply with his hands extending beyond his frame
length, just around off, and he defends this
length, nibbles back in, and he defends
length, just around off and middle, and he plays it towards short mid-wicket
full, outside off, and he stretches forward to drive to mid-off
length, just outside off, and he stretches to drive this between cover and point. Pierces the gap, but the timing isn't good enough to go all the way to the fence
length, and he comes forward to defend a ball around off
length, and he defends from the crease
length, a touch wider, and he looks to pull out the drive. Checks himself in the end. and just defends this towards cover
length, punched away from just outside off, and placed between point and cover. Easy two
ooh, good ball! A bit slower, off-cutter, and goes past the outside edge after pitching just outside off. Dickwella a little early into a defensive prod, and then pulls out a wry smile
length, and he presses forward to defend, but it runs off the inside edge, and just misses the leg stump! Some good variations in that over from Abbas
a little shorter in length, angles across Dickwella, who can cut this towards deep point. There's a sweeper in that position for him
length, straighter, bowled at 140kph, and he defends from the crease
length, a bit of movement back in from outside off, and he defends this towards point from the crease
shorter, angles in to him, and he goes on to the back foot and plays this towards cover
length, a bit wide of off, and he drives this, with one hand coming off the handle. Plays it along the ground towards cover
length, angles down his pads, and he can whip this off his pads towards square leg
length, around off, and he defends
length, angles into him, and he defends comfortably
length, angles into him, and he plays it towards short mid-wicket
length, and he goes back and punches this through the extra cover region. The ball hurtles away towards the boundary, but Usman Shinwari gives it a good chase from cover point and pulls it back
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he defends towards short cover

Naseem has another one, does he? Nips one from a good length from just outside off, and draws the outside edge from Dhananjaya. Rizwan leaps forward to collect, and the only question is whether this has carried to him or not. The umpires refer this to the third umpire, and from the first angle, front-on, it looks like it could have bounced just a bit ahead of the keeper. And the TV umpire stays with that decision. Close shave, but good bowling again from Naseem Shah!
looks for the yorker, but strays down the pads with a full toss, and DDS whips it off his pads. Takes two, and that takes him to fifty! Vital runs and some attractive batting along the way
short, angles into him, and he has to take evasive action. Kept his bat up, but far enough away from the ball
length, and he comes forward a touch and defends. That short ball has ensured that he won't be as trigger-happy when moving forward
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, around off, and left alone
length, and he defends from the crease
length, a bit slower, and Dickwella defends from the crease

slower, off cutter, and Dickwella shapes to flick this. Lucky for him, he reads it off the pitch and checks himself a touch. Still comes off the outer part of the bat and goes back towards Abbas along the ground
length, and he pushes this towards point
length, wider, and he stretches forward to push this towards cover
length, outside off, and some superb swing after it goes past Dickwella. He leaves
length, around off, and he leaves. Some good bounce on its way through to Rizwan
length, just outside off, and he leaves it again
length, left alone. A hint of swing away from the bat this time
length, a bit wider, and swings further away after pitching. De Silva wants nothing to do with balls he can leave alone right now
fuller, and he looks to drive. Squirts off the outside edge and goes through the gap between gully and point
length, zips back in after pitching outside off, and de Silva leaves
length on leg stump, defended into the midwicket region
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket on the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped back to the pitch
length on middle stump, steps out, looks to flick and cops it on the pad. Lbw appeal turned down
length on middle stump, gets low and sweeps to long leg
dropped short outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
short of a length at middle stump, looks to punch through cover, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length on leg stump, gets behind the line and whips it to short fine's left to beat his dive
length ball down leg side. Looks to flick and is beaten. I heard a sound there, edge and dropped? Hard to tell
length on leg stump, defended back to the bowler
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length on leg stump. Opens up his stance and looks to play the late cut. Can't get it further than pitch side on the off side
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
full and just outside off. Gets down for the reverse sweep and cops that on the boot
length on off stump, reverse sweep to deep backward point
full on middle stump, looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length and just outside off. Gets low and under it and sweeps aerially, and deliberately, to the long leg boundary
length outside off, gets down again and ramps this to long leg's left
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, taps to cover's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball just outside off, left alone
short of a length and pushed across middle stump. Defended to backward point on the back foot
full and just outside off. Punched firmly to mid-off with the full face offered
length and just outside off, looks to drive on the rise. Squeezed through the covers off the thick outside edge
length and shaping into the pads. Looks to flick and is rapped on the thigh guard. Going down after starting on a leg stump line

short of a length and into the thigh guard. Looks to flick and deflects it into the square leg region. A direct hit at the non-striker's end as they sneak a run. It deflects past mid-off and they get another
length ball slanted down leg side. Beaten on the flick
short of a length and swung in at the hips. Allows it to come on and dabs to fine leg
short of a length in the corridor and jagging away. Left alone
flies past gully. Short and wide and he chases it with only his hands, no feet movement at all. Chopped firmly and he survives
short of a length on leg stump, glanced to deep square off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, pushed into the covers with soft hands
short of a length and late shape away in the corridor. Watchfully defended into the off side

past the inside edge of the bat and then off stump! Wow that jumped back in. Shaping away at a length outside off and he wanted to drive on the up. But that landed on the seam and came back into the big gap between bat and pad
nicely timed this time. Length and shaping away just outside off. This time the front leg goes out and he leans into the punch to sweeper's left
full and just outside off, looks to drive, thick outside edge out to deep point
length ball outside off, looks to drive away from the body, gets an inside edge onto front pad
edge through the cordon. Length ball with some shape inwards in the corridor. He looks to flick and closes the face too early. Leading edge comfortably between second slip and gully
length ball outside off, leans in and looks to drive. Gets an inside edge onto pad
length on middle stump, drops his head into the off side and plays his trademark aerial clip over midwicket. Rolls into the boundary
length on middle stump, defended from the crease with the full face offered
past the inside edge again! Great delivery. Good length, bolt upright seam, jags it in from the corridor as he looks to play the cover drive for the angle
length at the stumps, some shape into the pads. Flicked to deep square
length ball just outside off, left alone
full and slight curve away in the corridor. Defended to point off the front foot
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch

taken at gully! He's kept on pushing away from the body and this time he pays for it. Length ball outside off, got the front leg half a stride across and jabbed at it away from the body. It sliced low to Babar at gully and he does well to get his fingers under that

past the inside edge again. Lovely areas from Shaheen and a lovely seam position is aiding him further. Length in the corridor. He looks to defend for the angle but this jags minimally back in to sail past off stump

big appeal for lbw turned down and Pakistan review it. Although somewhat reluctantly. Length ball at off and middle, angles back in and there are two sounds as he looks to defend this. Replays show that's the two pads. No bat on it at all...but that is pitching outside edge. Review lost. Very close though.
length ball swung down leg. Looks to flick but that's deflected off the outside of the pad
length ball just outside off, tentative prod in the corridor to get this to point. Feet aren't moving
full on off stump, pushes at it with hard hands. Thick inside edge to fine leg's left
length and just outside off. Stands tall and check-punches that on the up. Not quite off the middle but enough pace on that and mid-off is wide. Came off the low part of the bat
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length outside off, loose flap at it away from the body, inside edge onto the legs
inside edge to fine leg. Overpitched inswinger just outside off, hard hands out to poke at it

rips the stumps down after fielding in his follow through. Length ball with some shape in. Punched back down the pitch. Catches it on the bounce and takes down middle stump as the batsman hops back in
beats the outside edge. Length ball in the corridor, goes away this time as he defends for the one that comes in
length, just angles across him, and he plays it with a dead bat towards cover from the crease
length, angles across from leg, and he gets behind the line to defend

fuller, and wider, and a gorgeous cover drive! Angles across him, and he takes a short step forward and eases into a languid drive through the cover region. This guy can drive well, as he's shown repeatedly in this innings. Seems to have an extra second when facing the quicks
length, just outside off, nibbling away and it goes through past the outside edge as Perera has a half-hearted waft at it
length, outside off, and he leaves. This keeps low a touch again
length, seams away after pitching outside off, and he leaves
length, swings away from outside off, and he leaves
ooh, bowled! Fuller, and pitches around off and seams and swings away. Perera gets nowhere near it, but he did well to try and get behind the line
length, straighter, and he defends this from the crease. Delivered at 143.2kph, Naseem rounds off an over where he asked some good questions of Perera
length, cuts this towards point, where Abid Ali dives away to his left to cut it off
fuller, and he comes forward to drive. Ends up defending this towards mid-off
fuller, and he drives through covers again. This pulls up just inside the cover boundary, and Azhar Ali is able to pull it back after putting in a game chase from mid-off
fuller, towards off stump, and he defends this wide of point. Easy single
fuller, just outside off, and he square-drives this through the vacant cover-point region. The ball pulls up ahead of the boundary again
length, just outside off, and he defends from the crease with a little hop to get over the bounce
length, just outside off, and nips away after pitching. Beats the outside edge again, and goes with some healthy bounce through to Rizwan
fuller, but on the pads, and he flicks this away. Not that well timed, and it goes towards deep mid-wicket but is pulled back comfortably

ooh, he's gotten away with this one! Length ball, jags back into him, and he looks to defend. Inside edge, and the ball bounces just beyond off, and he loses the sight of it completely. Came back and almost disturbed the leg stump too!
length, and he consciously comes forward to defend. Off the inner part of the bat back into his pad and drops dead near him
shorter, and he goes back and punches this towards a man stationed now at deep point
short, and he ducks under this one. This last ball bowled at 142.1kph
length, and he leaves this as it angles across him
length, and he punches this towards point
length, a touch fuller, and angles across him and he drops his wrists to let it pass
fuller, and he flicks this towards mid-wicket. Abbas goes across from mid-on to stop this
length, gets a little bit of nip back in towards the batsman, and strikes him high on the pad. Half-thoughts about an appeal, but good bowling!
length, and he lets this pass as it slants across him
presses forward and defends a length ball around off

length, and he hangs back and looks to punch it through covers. There's a little slant back into him, and he is forced to defend it back towards the bowler. Chides himself for not having come forward more
short, and dispatched! Places this in front of square, having picked up the length early. It was aimed outside off, but it didn't matter at all
full, and he drives moving forward a touch. Goes to mid-off
length, wide outside off, and de Silva chases this. Just past the edge, swings further away and lands short of Rizwan
short of a length just outside off. Jumps up as he lets it go
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg with the angle
short of a length just outside off, punched to deep point off the back foot
short of slip. Length outside off, leans in to defend and gets a thick edge that's well in front of first slip
length in the corridor, solidly defended on the front foot
slashed to third man. Short of a length and wide outside off. Dilruwan has a might swish at that and it flies off the thick outside edge, over the cordon
length outside off, gets forward and looks to flick. Gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls down the pitch
length ball just outside off with some shape way. Shuffles and defends from deep in the crease
length just outside off, shuffles and clips wide of mid-on off the back foot to get into the nineties
length at off stump, behind the line to defend off the back foot
length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked to fine leg's left off the toe-end. The lack of pace on that shot allows them a second

into the boundary from under the fielder. Length on leg stump and slanted in with the angle. Stays tall and tickles this to Abbas' right at fine leg and it's too quick as he trundles across and tumbles over the ball
length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
past the outside edge. Length ball jags away from the surface in the corridor after drawing him forward for the defence
inside edge as this one cuts back in from a length and the same line outside off. Onto pad as he looks to defend
length and in at middle stump, solidly defended to mid-on
driven aerially but in the gap. Length ball just outside off, gets on the front foot, drives on the up and into the extra cover boundary. Turning bat
short of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
length outside off, bat-padded as he looks to defend
length at off stump, jammed into the leg side off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper's right
length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops that on the pad
length ball just outside off, defended off the inside edge onto boot
beaten! Oh that's loose. Full ball curving away, very wide outside off. Gets forward and chucks the bat at it, well away from the body
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square leg off the back foot

brings up the hundred with a sublime drive. Length ball just outside off, leans forward and gets the weight into this. More DDS than that hack last ball. He's been solid this innings in much more difficult conditions. On the first sunny morning, he reaps the rewards. Neatly punched wide of mid-off
length on off stump, clipped to mid-on's right off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
bouncer down leg side, left alone
length at off stump, defended into the covers
full and curving in late in the corridor. Left alone
length and angled across from leg stump. Defended down the pitch
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length on off stump, solidly defended down the pitch

an appeal for catch at gully. Umpires will check if that was a bump ball. It was a full ball outside off, he jabbed at it and got it off the outside edge. But did it bounce before gully leaped one-handed to his right to take this? Soft signal not out. Oh also he has overstepped by a long way. 'Alright we can stop there,' says the umpire as they go up for replays. The ball had also clearly taken a bounce so, if anything, Pakistan have gained from that delivery
yorker length just outside off, jammed into the covers
length and just outside off, solidly defended from the crease
short of a length and across off stump. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, solidly defended on the back foot
length on middle stump, gets the front leg across and clips it through midwicket for this first runs in Test cricket
length ball pushed wide outside off, left alone

yorker tails in late and locks him up as he gets a stride across into the off side. Just manages to squeeze it out. Sri Lanka appeal for the lbw, asking if there was boot on that before bat. They won't review it. And rightly so, there was no boot on that
length and just outside off, watchfully defended on the back foot
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket on the rise
length ball just outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off
bouncer up at the front shoulder. He thinks about the pull but that hurries him and he has to let that go

taps a full toss straight to mid-off! Yikes. I suppose you can put that down to a groggy mind from four days of gloom. It's a knee height full toss just outside off, all he has to do is caress that through the covers. He ends up simulating a catching practice session, straight into the body of the fielder
full and in at middle and leg. Defended to mid-on
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
beaten. Flashes wide outside off. This is overpitched and wide outside off and he's looking to drive into the off side with the feet not going too far forward
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
overpitched and pushed across the batsman. Left alone
cuts past the outside edge. Length ball slammed in at a leg stump line and jumps away after squaring him on the back foot defence. Dies on the keeper who is forced to parry it behind the cordon
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball just outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
length at off stump, 139.5kph, solidly blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, nudges that to fine leg
length ball just outside off, defended off the inside half of the bat
length on leg stump, nudged to square leg off the back foot
length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
slashed over the cordon. Short and wide outside off, goes wholeheartedly with the cut and it flies over the slips off the thick edge
full and wide outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, driven to midwicket's left
full and wide outside off, with some late movement away. But he won't get a shot out of that
length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
length and angled into the corridor. Slight tail inwards. Bat-padded on the front foot
length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
bouncer at a leg stump line. Sways late to let it go
length and just outside off. Defended to gully off the outside half
length and into the pads. Plonks the front leg across the stumps and flicks this to fine leg
full, wide and he has a waft at it. but misses
fuller, just around off, and he leans into a superb cover drive. Didn't over-stretch, and just timed it well enough to beat the man running across from mid-off

length, around off, and he drives this towards point. Yes, no, yes between the wickets, and eventually Azhar has to put in the dive at the non-striker's end! No contact with the stumps with the throw, though
length, swings away a touch, and he leaves
length, around off, and he lets it pass. Goes along the ground a bit
fuller, but pitches well outside leg. Thuds into his pads as he looks to flick and runs towards short fine-leg
length, just around off, and he gets on top of this to punch towards cover
length, around off, and he leaves
length, presses forward to defend. Bowled around off
length, and he leans forward to defend
dug in short, angles in, and he ducks under this one. Swerves a bit late and goes through to the keeper high to his left
fuller, just outside off, floated up a touch at 132.3kph, but Azhar doesn't care for a nibble
fuller, straighter, and he defends this towards short mid-wicket
full, and he drives this hard back into the ground. Bounces past Kumara, and is fielded by mid-on. The batsmen abandon early thoughts of taking a quick single
length, just outside off, goes on with the angle, and Abid leaves
shorter, wider, and Abid leaves. Could have had runs had he gone back and tried to guide this through the off side, but he chooses discretion is the better part of valour, this early
fuller, on the pads, and he drives this hard towards mid-on
length, zips in from outside off, and he defends coming forward
length, outside off, and he shoulders arms

straighter, fuller, and he drives this towards mid-on. The fieldsman there is Vishwa Fernando, who gets across to his left quickly, but cannot stop it cleanly. Just a hand to it, and the ricochet allows the single
length, whipped wide of short mid-wicket
length, and he whips this wide of short mid-wicket. Quick single taken
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length and just outside off, defended to point

ooh, chance, but missed! Length ball, around off, and he has a slash at this. Takes the outside edge and flies off, and goes through the vacant third slip! A dive from second slip across to his right, and it just evades his grasp
ah, great response from the fast bowler. Well directed short ball, cramps him up for room, and Abid gets into an awkward position as he drops his wrists. Just past his shoulder
length, comes forward and defends towards cover
short of a length, bounces into him at 138kph, and he defends from the crease
length, moves back in sharply from outside off, and he leaves. Doesn't pass a long way away from the off-stump, but good judgement from the batsman
short, and he rocks back and cuts this hard. Gets his little frame off the ground as he plays this, with a flourish of the wrists to keep it along the ground. Top shot!
short, and he goes back and punches this through cover-point. No turn on this, from outside off, and gives Azhar every opportunity to cash in. He obliges
length, around off, and he stretches to drive towards mid-on
length, and he goes back to defend this. Doesn't turn a lot, and goes towards cover
length, a bit of turn back in from outside off, and he defends with a dead bat
length, but slow enough turn to allow him to go back and whip this towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he plays this off his hips towards square leg
length, straight, and he whips this towards short mid-wicket
short, and he goes back and punches this towards deep backward point. Superb shot, just uses the pace of the ball and ensures that this goes way to the left of point
short of a length, angles in, and he plays this towards short mid-wicket
fuller, just outside off, and he presses forward to push this to mid-off
length, angles in, and he presses forward to defend with a dead bat

oh, sublime! Fuller, a touch wider, and he just leans into a drive past mid-off. Holds the pose, no backlift, for the photographers as the ball races past the man stationed there towards the long-off fence. Terrific bit of timing
length, towards leg stump, and he goes back to flick this towards mid-wicket. A slight misfield by short mid-wicket, but the fielder from the deep attacks the ball and prevents a single
fuller, on the pads, and he whips this away towards deep mid-wicket
fuller, on the pads, turning in, and he flicks this to the right of short mid-wicket
fuller, towards middle and leg, and he can whip this towards deep mid-wicket
length, around middle, and he presses forward to defend this towards short mid-wicket
presses forward to defend a length ball at middle and leg
short, towards his left armpit, and he wafts this away towards fine leg. Well dealt with in the end, as that was coming at him fairly quickly
short, angles down the leg side, and he can play this away comfortably towards fine leg. This was at 150kph!
short, and he leaves this. Bounces way over Abid's head. This was bowled at 142kph
shorter, well directed again, as it moves in from outside off. Abid does well to sway away to the leg side and drop his wrists as he does so. This was at 144kph
length, around middle and leg, and he plays this off his hips towards long leg
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend. Drops it off the inside of his bat on to his front foot, and they cross through for a comfortable single
length, around off, and he guides this with soft hands towards point. They go through for a quick single, as the man has to move across to his left before collecting
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, a bit quicker at 87kph, and he goes back to whip this towards short mid-wicket
length, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, and he drives this wide of mid-on

length, and he presses forward to drive this to the left of cover. They think about going for two, but decide against it after making a quarter of the way through! Could have been close if they hadn't put the brakes on collectively
length, presses forward to defend one around off stump
short, angles in across him and down the leg side. Easy leave for Azhar
shorter, angles in to him from outside off, and he gets up on his toes to defend
fuller, and he stretches forward and drives this through covers. Perfect high elbow, and gets it through with good pace and precision. Shot!
length, comes back in from outside off, and he defends
length, turns in from outside off, and he goes back to defend this
length, turns across him, and he plays from the crease and turns it to the right of square leg
fuller, and he skips forward to drive this. Cut off by short mid-wicket, diving away to his left
full, and he drives this back down the pitch. Perera picks it up low to his right
full, and he drives this wide of mid-on
presses forward to smother a length ball around off, turning back in
length ball pushed down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
length ball taken away from the corridor, left alone
full ball wide outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, tickled to fine leg with an angled bat
length ball angled into the pads. Nudged through square leg with the angle
full outside off, drives to mid-off with feet rooted to crease
length and just outside off, tapped into the off side on the back foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full and just outside off, sliced to deep backward point
length outside off, pushed into the point region on the front foot
length on middle stump, clipped to short fine off the back foot
length and pushed through just outside off. Hurriedly defended on the front foot
length and in at leg stump, nudged to mid-on's right off the back foot

overpitched on leg stump, allows that to come on and drives firmly to deep square's left. Long chase for the fielder but the batsmen have still given him a chance to run them out. Azhar runs all the way back after taking half the third run
inside edge onto pad. Length ball tight at the stumps. It's a nervous prod and he draws an lbw appeal from the bowler
length ball angled in at off stump and straightening. Defended off the outside half of the bat
full on leg stump, flicked along the floor to deep square
length on off stump, pushed to midwicket
full outside off, leans in and drives to cover's left. A fumble after a dive from the fielder
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
full on off stump, driven back down the pitch
length just outside off, dead-batted on the front foot

just wide of the diving midwicket fielder! Short ball into his ribs, looks for the pull and is backing away and awkward. It comes off the high part of the bat and just floats to the right of Karunaratne
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length and just outside off, jabbed into the covers on the front foot
full and just outside off. Not quite leaning into it but the full face offered on this straight drive and a nice high elbow. Bat turns in the hand slightly, but it's past mid-off quickly enough
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and just outside off. Defended off the inside half
full ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, driven to extra cover
length on middle stump, steps out and drives to mid-on
length outside off, driven against the turn to mid-off
full on off stump, driven at mid-off
length and just outside off, poked behind point with soft hands on the back foot
length ball just outside off, left alone
length and just outside off, pushes with firm hands on the front foot, bat turns in the hands

full and in at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left. Karunaratne lunges to field it but is now clutching his knee. Did he jam it into the turf? Looks like the ball hit him, actually. In the soft tissue under the knee cap
dropped short at leg stump, hooked along the ground to fine leg
length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
length and curving away just outside off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg's left off the back foot
fires one flat and down leg. He gets down and laps this past short fine with ease
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length on middle stump, picks short fine with the sweep
length ball just outside off, left alone

past the mid-on fielder. Full ball into the stumps, stood tall and offered the full face to gently punch this down the ground. Kumara pushed hard to his left but was just not quick enough to reach that
length outside off, defended to gully on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
overpitched just outside off, tapped to extra cover on the front foot
length and just outside off, defended into the off side from deep in the crease
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length and just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, gets behind the line and punches it through the vacant covers
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, solidly punched off the back foot to fine extra cover
length and into the corridor. Pushed into the covers from the crease
short ball at off stump, does't quite rise as he ducks and he's had to watch that closely

fifty on debut. Nice and positive from Abid Ali today. Becomes the first Pakistani to make a fifty at home in a decade too. Length ball just outside off, allows that to come on and opens the face late to get it between gully and backward point. Nice response from the crowd too
full, around off, and he drives firmly to mid-off
short, and he goes back and tucks it towards square leg with the turn across him from middle

length, down the pads, and he tickles this fine. Long leg gets across to fine leg and fields, but not before they come through for two. They've had a couple of iffy moments when running between the wickets, but this was much better
presses forward to defend a length ball around off. A hint of turn back in, but well covered
length, angles across him, goes on with the arm, and he leans forward to defend
full, and he drives this towards mid-off
length, hint of inward movement after pitching, and he punches this towards cover
length, and he presses forward to defend this towards point. Pitching around off, jagging back in a touch off the seam
length, jags in off the line just outside, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, angles in, and he drives this firmly towards mid-on

GONE! A soft dismissal for the captain, as he chips a short-of-a-length ball that stops a bit on him. Angled in from wide of the crease, and he ends up playing a check-drive straight into the midriff of short mid-wicket. Due reward for Kumara, who has looked threatening right from his first over!
fast. zips in from outside off at 146kph, and takes the inside edge on to thigh pad and down by the leg stump. Spicy stuff from Kumara!
length, outside off, and he looks to cut, but it sneaks under the outside edge
length, and he goes back to flick this off his pads towards short mid-wicket
full, on the pads, and he sweeps this fine. Doesn't get it off the middle, and allows long leg to come in and cut this off

ooh, chancy! Tossed up around off, and goes on with the angle across him from around the stumps. Abid has a slash at it, looking to go towards cover. Flies off the edge and past first slip down to third man
full, and he plays it with the turn towards square leg. Easy single
driven, pressing forward, to deep mid-off
dug in short, bowled at 139kph, and he ducks under this. Angles down the leg side
short, and he rises nicely to play this down with a dead bat towards short mid-wicket. Fast again, from Kumara!
short, and he hops to defend this. Comes into him from just outside off, and he plays it well, after getting behind the line
short, wide of off, and he cuts this firmly, but straight to point
full, straight, and he drives this as it angles into him, towards mid-on
fuller, around off, and he defends with a slight forward press. Compact and outstanding from Abid
length, and he goes back to punch this towards short mid-wicket
length, slides on a touch from outside off. Babar goes back and defends from the crease, adjusting late to cover the lack of turn
fuller, and he drives this with the turn from outside off towards deep mid-on
short, and he goes back and cuts this towards deep point
fuller, wider, and he drives this towards cover. Beats the man close to the bat, but not mid-off, running across
tossed up around off, and he stretches forward to defend
dug in short, and he ducks under this one. Well directed again by Kumara, as it would have homed in on his helmet badge had he been standing upright
uppish, did that carry? Wider from Kumara, and he slashes at this. A bit shorter in length, and it flies off his edge, but lands possibly just short of Dilruwan Perera at gully
sharp, from outside off, angles back in, and goes off the outer part of his bat towards gully along the ground
short, and he ducks under this one
fuller, straighter, and he drives. His bottom hand comes off as he looks to guide this past mid-on, but he cannot place it enough to the left of the man there
short of a length, shapes back in from outside off, and he defends. Bowled at 138.7kph this time
length, defended from the crease
presses forward to drive a length ball back towards the bowler
short, a bit wide, and he goes back and cuts this towards deep point
length, and he goes back to punch this towards cover
tossed up around off, bowled at just 81.8kph, and he presses forward to defend

ah, that was close to off stump! A wry smile from Babar Azam as this turns back in sharply from outside off, and just about goes over the top of off. First ball that has really ripped on this day from Perera
length, outside off, and he goes back and punches this wide of cover. There's a sweeper on the off side who will cut it off, though
length, keeps a bit low, but he goes back and drives this solidly towards cover
short, and he ducks underneath this one. Outside off, and hence no problems for Abid
looks for the yorker, but Abid is prepared, as he digs it out to the right of mid-on. Easy single
length, straightens into him, and he defends
fuller, and he drives. Not completely in control, as it skews off the inner part of the bat towards short mid-wicket
length, turns back in from outside off, and he watchfully defends with a slight shuffle across to the off stump
fuller, and he drives this hard, but doesn't get a lot of distance on it. Comfortably fielded at cover
short, and he goes back and punches this towards deep point

fuller, and he stretches forward, and plays a picture-perfect square drive! Nobody guarding the point fence, and once he got it past the man at point, he knew this was heading for four. Didn't need to step out of the crease for any runs
guides a length ball with an open face of the bat to the left of cover, and they scurry through for a single
length, a bit of turn into him from outside off, and Abid goes back to play this with a solid bat face towards square leg
length, channel outside off, and he leaves stretching forward
length, and he stretches forward to defend towards a man at short cover
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
short, outside off, and he lets this pass. Too wide for the umpire's comfort, as it went way over his head
looks to go full, and strays down the pads. Whipped away towards long leg

length, and he hops on to the back foot and drives this between cover and mid-off. Lots of work for the man in the deep, and before the return can come through, they go for the third. Needs to throw in the dive to get back, but does so quite effectively!
fuller, around off, and he plays with a slightly open face, to guide it past point. Easy single to the man sweeping in the deep
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend
fuller ball, a bit of turn in, and takes the inside edge and then strikes pad. A bit of a shout from Dickwella behind the stumps
fuller, and he flicks with the turn towards short mid-wicket
length, around off, and he presses forward to smother this
short, and he skips forward to drive this towards deep mid-on. To be fair, he may have shortened the length a bit seeing Azam take a shimmy forward
defends a length ball around off from the crease
dropped short and very wide. Left alone. Keeper and slip chuckle at the bowler for that
short and wide outside off, chopped out to sweeper cover
dropped short at middle stump, pulled aerially out to deep square
dropped short and down leg side, pulled firmly to backward square
short of a length and rising outside off. Left alone
