full toss lobbed right up outside off. Mistimed cut to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-on
leading edge lands safely in front of the bowler. Length outside off, leans in and closes the face early on the flick
length on off stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and skidding on outside off. Looks for the late cut, gets it off the inside edge into the overs
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, pushes against the turn to mid-off and calls early for the run
dropped short and wide outside off. Hammered on the up to sweeper cover
very short, very wide outside off. Backs away and slaps it past backward point
and again. Dropped short and turning away outside off. Waits on that and this time he cuts it firmly in front of backward point
short of a length and turning away outside off. Cut to backward point
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
smacked to the extra cover boundary! Friendly overpitched ball lobbed right up with lots of room and he jumps to the pitch of that and gives this everything with the drive
length and turning in at off stump. Flicked to deep backward square
ah glorious. But Sri Lanka are really giving away some easy runs here. This is lobbed up at off stump and he only has to put in half a stride before driving firmly to mid-off's left
full outside off, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven back down the pitch
full toss outside off, watches that closely and knocks it between extra cover and mid-off
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover's right on the up
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven to long-on with the turn
length and just outside off, gets deep in the crease and punches to sweeper's right
full on off stump, flicked to midwicket's right
full at middle stump. Goes down for the sweep and nearly yorks himself. Just manages to get the bat down and gets a run at square leg
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
length on middle stump, leans in and drives to long-on
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle stump, steps out and defends down the pitch
length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
does what he wants, this guy. Full outside off, reaches out at that to make the pitch of it and drives it well to the right of deep point
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length on middle, steps out and drives to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
length on leg stump, clipped into the leg side off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tossed up at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length at off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, pushed to backward square
length on middle stump, paddled straight to backward square leg
full and just outside off, tapped to cover's left
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length ball down leg side, looks for the lap sweep, can't get it away
length and just outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a length just outside off, chops this onto the pitch off the inside edge as he looks to punch through the covers
full and in at the stumps, gets forward and punches neatly to mid-on
short of a length and into the body. He's cramped there and hurried. Forced to defended awkwardly into the leg side
bouncer at a leg stump line, ducks under that
full and just outside off, leans in and drives to mid-off's left
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full on middle stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
drilled past the non-striker. These are throwdowns. Flat and full outside off, nice pace on it. Gets the front leg down and gets it all along the floor to the straight boundary
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length on leg stump, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer in the corridor, sways away to let that go
full and tailing in at leg stump. Punched to mid-on with the angle
short of a length just outside off, looks to punch through the covers but is cramped. Back down the pitch off the inside half
length and just outside off. Dropped into the covers off the back foot
full, on the pads, and he plays it to square leg
full, on the pads, and driven towards wide mid-on
full, and he walks across to swat this back. Almost yorks himself, and drives this hard back towards the bowler, on the bounce
length, and he hangs back and defends one going across him
full, and he drives hard, but straight to short mid-wicket
length, towards leg stump, and he looks to glance, but there's a short fine-leg in place

length, zips back in from outside off, and he unleashes a gorgeous check-drive through covers, to bring up fifty! This has been a fabulous innings, though he would have loved to have struck this on Day 2 for it to have had more context, I'm sure
full ball, and he digs it out towards short cover. Quick call from Abid Ali, and he responds immediately to tick the strike over
short of a length, angles in to his pads, and he tries to play this away towards fine leg. Hurries on to him, and strikes him high on the thigh pad
short, down the leg side, and he can duck underneath this. This was 141kph - Kumara is refreshed after the breather and will look to crank it up again
short again, attacking his ribs, and he jumps to defend this away with a dead bat towards short mid-wicket
short, angles across him from outside leg, and he jumps to get on top of the bounce. Drops it dead on the off side
full ball, and he plays a lap sweep. This slows down towards the boundary along the thicker parts of the outfield, and enables Abid to come back on strike
full, around middle and leg, and he defends from the crease
angles across him, goes straight on with the arm, and beats the outside edge, as Abid looks to defend from the crease
skips down the wicket, and gets to the pitch of a good length ball, flays it towards cover. It goes to the left of the man there and allows them to go through for one
tossed up, driven back hard towards the bowler
presses forward, and drives a fuller ball inside out towards wide mid-off
short, and he swings this towards short mid-wicket. Wanted to place it either side of the man there, but ended up hitting it hard, into the ground, and straight at the fielder there
short again, and this time is sits up and begs to be spanked away. He swings this towards long leg. No man there, and that's a comfortable boundary
full, towards middle and leg, and he drives towards mid-on
short, wide, and he spanks this away through cover-point. Majestic!
full toss, and he goes back to defend this. Kumara, possibly a bit frustrated, and also tiring from a big effort at the bowling crease on a slightly warmer day
length, angles in, and he comes forward to defend this
length, angles across him, and he drives it firmly back towards the bowler
uses his feet to skip down to this, driven towards long-off. Deep mid-off will cut it off and keep it down to two
presses forward to drive towards mid-off
length, and he goes back to defend towards square leg
length, defended towards short mid-wicket
flicks one on his pads towards short fine-leg
length, and he drives this firmly, but straight to cover
slower ball, down the leg side, and he looks to flick, but cannot lay bat on this. Bounces through to the keeper
length, angles in, and he dabs it towards point. Easy single, as the fielders are slightly deeper now with the runs flowing off Babar's blade
short, and defended from the crease with a little hop to ride the extra bounce
short, angles across him this time. Might have been cross-seam, but he ducks under this, swaying out of the way in the process
back of a length, and he goes back to punch this towards cover
backs away to the on side and opens up the off side as the ball is bowled around the pads. Swats this away inside out, and gets two before long-off can cut this off
fired quicker, down the leg side and he lets it pass
slow, short, and he has pummelled this through the covers. Babar into the 70s!
flicked with the turn towards square leg
length, angles into him, a bit quicker when bowling to Abid. He plays it towards square leg
short, and he can move across and place this to the right of the man at square leg. Single helps him retain the strike
short, in front of his face, and he swats this away. More of a forehand crosscourt, and it speeds away to the mid-wicket fence! 99 for Abid Ali!

short, and there it is! Goes back and pumps this through covers. Has a bit of a slip at the non-striker's end, but comes back for two. Takes his helmet off and raises both arms to the sky. Abid Ali is the first man in cricket history to strike a ton on both ODI and Test debut. That is quite remarkable, considering the first ODI was back in January 1971. He gets a warm bearhug from Babar. The stadium rises as one to applaud him
short of a length, and he goes on to the back foot and punches this towards cover
ooh, beats the outside edge with a good ball! Length, nips away a touch, and he has an attempt at a drive, but cannot connect
fuller, and driven towards mid-on
length, and driven towards mid-on
length, and he drives this with the turn towards mid-on
full, wide and spanked towards deep point
defends a length ball around leg and middle
full, and he swats this away towards deep backward square leg
flicks a length ball off his hips towards square leg
length, around leg stump, and he dabs this towards short fine leg, and retains strike
length, from around the wicket, and he drives towards mid-on
length, outside off, and he flays this away towards extra cover. The man from backward point runs across and puts in a dive. Just about saved the boundary with his effort, it appears
short, and he swings this through mid-wicket. Man at the deep square leg fence runs around to his left, but is beaten by the pace on this. Great wristwork to make this speed away down the ground!
length, and he punches this wide of point towards the man in the deep off the back foot
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length, and he drives this back hard towards mid-on
defended towards square leg
skips forward, and defends a ball that turns back in
sweeps a ball around leg stump, and fielded by short fine-leg. Had this gone through, would have been at least three, if not four!
length, and he presses forward to defend
short, goes back and crashes this through deep mid-wicket. Got it wide of the player at deep square leg, and hit it with a lot of power
stretches forward, and drive this to deep mid-wicket. Retains strike
drives hard, towards cover
presses forward to defend a length ball
fuller, down the leg side, and he looks to sweep but misses
length, and he defends from the crease. A bit of quick turn back in
flighted, around off, and he drives it hard back towards the bowler
comes forward and drives against the turn towards wide mid-off
length, and he goes back and flicks this away towards square leg
drives a fuller ball towards deep extra cover
length, and he plays it away towards short fine leg
length, goes on with the angle from around the wicket, takes the outside edge and runs down towards third man. They scamper a third, to enable Babar to get to the strike
presses forward to defend a length ball
short, down the pads, and Dickwell fails to gather. They go through for a bye, as it scuttles away towards fine leg
length, and he flicks it away towards short fine-leg
uses his feet to come close to this. Dilruwan drops it a touch shorter. He flicks this towards short mid-wicket

uses his feet to open up the offisde, and then donks this through the cover-point region. Not off the middle, but good enough to carry through to the fence. Smart batting, as the 150-run partnership comes up. Babar Azam has contributed 94 of those!
short, and he goes back and pushes this towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he defends. Wants to give Babar the strike for the next over, one would imagine
length, defended, as he comes around the wicket
drives one around off, hard towards mid-off
length, nudges this towards point
length, and he has flicked this away towards deep mid-wicket. Protection there means it will take him to 97
length, and he stretches forward to defend
full, and driven back hard towards Dhananjaya on his follow-through
fuller, around off, and he drives this down to deep mid-off. Refuses the single so Babar can start on strike

short, punches this through covers, and that's a hundred on home debut for Babar Azam! Lets out a scream as soon as he connects, and roars as he takes his helmet off, punching the air with his right hand. The crowd stands as one to applaud their favourite. Superlative effort, and as I said before, pity that the context of this innings couldn't be a greater one
length, and he plays this towards cover
length, and he pushes this towards long-on
pushed through covers
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
defends from the crease
full on middle, driven to long-on
length on off, defended on the front foot
length on off, blocked on the front foot
low full toss, flicked to short midwicket
length on middle stump, a loose drive. Looks to go off side, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
full on leg stump, defended into the leg side
